title: How far we've come
body:
Of course I'm only a year or so into game, so I can't exactly talk like I'm a true veteran of the game or anything but... Looking back at League's older and even the original animations that came with the game, I have to say that the level of progress in terms of storytelling and animation quality is phenomenal. If there's one thing I can say I have always been satisfied with and pleasantly surprised by, it's 100% the animations and the quality and depth they bring to Runeterra. 

Specifically speaking, the newest Ryze animation was pretty good, I enjoyed it myself and it definitely met the standard of previous works, my only nitpick being that in the scene just before Ryze teleports into the sanctuary, he brushes some leaves off of a stone carving; they sounded kind of glassy and inorganic to me despite being _leaves_ so it caused a bit of mental discord for me, confusion between what I heard and what I saw. 

I can't wait to see what Riot has in store next, and just thinking about it makes me super excited.

replies.body: It’s becasu they were dead dry leaves. Meaning they were hard leaves

Actually, they're petrified leaves - leaves that have turned to stone in this instance.
That sound that TonyWolf77 heard is the glassy-clinking of thin, fragile, stone leaves :)

Petrified or petricited? Which is the correct one in this case? 
{{sticker:sg-syndra}}

> [{quoted}](name=Loborcs,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=E1wyAjLh,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-26T18:05:50.714+0000)
>
> Petrified or petricited? Which is the correct one in this case? {{sticker:sg-syndra}}

Either, though "petrified" is a real word, and 'petricited' would be a brand new invented word.

From Galio's [Biography](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/galio/):

>Exhausted from days without rest, the refugees hid among the shadows of an ancient, petrified forest. The sorcerers that pursued them suddenly found their magic to be ineffective in the strange woods.

It was above all a joke (I knew about that) but since the question appeared...
Could be "petricited" if the leaves had magical-nullyfing properties?
Ouch, I hadn't seen this reply yet, so sorry for being late. That's a satisfying enough answer for me, I doubt I'll ever get used to the sensory confusion though XD
a year in and not disappointed yet its funny to see how some people still have hope in riot
